New in and children's reading ideas

Get reading ideas straight to your inbox. Sign up for our monthly newsletter.

We stock thousands of children's books, both fiction and non-fiction. Here are some reviews, suggestions and lists of new books for children aged 0-11.

New children's books for May 2017

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Apr 28, 2017

Old favourites and new characters abound in this month's new children's books

New children's books for April 2017

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Mar 29, 2017

This month's titles feature all manner of animals and a couple of babies too

Check out children's books by authors from around the world for International Children's Book Day

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Mar 29, 2017

Sunday 2 April is International Children's Book Day. To mark the occasion, we've picked out some great books from foreign authors.

Mark St Patrick's Day with a children's book by a talented Irish author or illustrator

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Mar 16, 2017

17 March is St Patrick's Day. Why not mark the occasion by picking up a brilliant children's book by an Irish author or illustrator?

Great children's titles to complement the new live-action Beauty and the Beast film

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Mar 15, 2017

The live action version of Beauty and the Beast, starring Emma Watson and Dan Stevens, is showing in cinemas from Friday 17 March. To mark the occasion, we've picked up some top Beauty and the Beast-related titles.

Mark British Science Week with these fascinating non-fiction books for children

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Mar 10, 2017

British Science Week 2017 runs from 10-19 March. What better excuse to pick up one of our science books for children?

New children's books for March 2017

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Feb 28, 2017

This month's titles feature a hungry dragon, a chocolate-hearted dragon and a painted dragon.

Borrow a beautiful book from the CILIP Kate Greenaway Medal longlist

Written by Alice Violett · Published Feb 16, 2017

The 2017 CILIP Kate Greenaway Medal longlist has been announced. The prize celebrates the best-illustrated children's and Young Adult books from the past year.

Choose from 20 brilliant books for children and young adults on the prestigious 2017 CILIP Carnegie Medal longlist

Written by Alice Violett · Published Feb 16, 2017

The 2017 CILIP Carnegie Medal longlist has been announced. This prestigious book prize recognises the best children's and Young Adult titles published each year.

Pick up an excellent book from the 2017 Waterstones Children's Book Prize shortlist

Written by Alice Violett · Published Feb 8, 2017

Optimism and inspiration leap from the pages of this year's nominations for the Waterstones Children's Book Prize.

New children's books for February 2017

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Jan 30, 2017

This month's new titles feature a wolf, our old friend Spot the dog, a parade of bears and more

New children's books for January 2017

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Jan 3, 2017

This month's children's book list features a penguin, a panda and a rhino.

Great fictional diaries for children and teens

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Jan 3, 2017

Is it your child's new year's resolution to keep a diary? These great fictional journals could inspire them.

We Wish You a Merry Christmas, by Yu-Hsuan Huang

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Dec 24, 2016

Today's book is We Wish You a Merry Christmas, by Yu-Hsuan Huang.

The Laugh Out Loud Joke Book, by Michael Rosen

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Dec 23, 2016

Today's book is The Laugh Out Loud Joke Book, by Michael Rosen.

Julius Zebra: Bundle with the Britons!, by Gary Northfield

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Dec 22, 2016

Today's book is Julius Zebra: Bundle with the Britons!, by Gary Northfield.

Usborne Christmas Quiz Book, by Simon Tudhope & Kate Rimmer

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Dec 21, 2016

Today's book is Usborne Christmas Quiz Book, by Simon Tudhope & Kate Rimmer.

Wigglesbottom Primary: The Magic Hamster, by Pamela Butchart & Becka Moor

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Dec 20, 2016

Today's book is Wigglesbottom Primary: The Magic Hamster, by Pamela Butchart & Becka Moor.

Jack Frost, by Kazuno Kohara

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Dec 18, 2016

Today's book is Jack Frost, by Kazuno Kohara.

Animasaurus: incredible animals that roamed the earth, by Tracey Turner & Harriet Russell

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Dec 18, 2016

Today's book is Animasaurus: incredible animals that roamed the earth, by Tracey Turner & Harriet Russell.
